page.title: 01Village of Caister on Sea
page.content: 80% of this block consists of sea Land area is the northern part of village and the coastal strip dominated by caravan sites and a holiday centre. Land is flat, mostly of sea level, protected from flooding by a sea defense wall. Beach is sandy wide ad above high water mark is covered with moram grass as a deterent against coastal erosion. No industry except holiday industry, the majority of people who live here work in nearby town of Great Yarmouth. A few in shore fishermen operate from beach and provide crew for volunteer lifeboat service. Many shops related to holiday trade,gift shops, cafes etc only open during summer months when the population increases by over 100%. Houses in this port of village are mainly older type, many 19c fishermens cottage now converted to modern homes.
